intro: Epacris exserta, commonly known as the slender epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as woodlands and heathlands. It produces pink to purple flowers during the spring and summer months, attracting various pollinators. Epacris exserta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
